participants.name: Aaron Sher
participants.description: Studied Civil engineering at University of the Witwatersrand

messages.message:
Aaron
Hi Brian,   Hope all is well.  merry Xmas and happy New Year.

Aaron
barbara got scammed on her computer and called an 800 number posing as microsoft.  She gave them a credit card number for network protection services !!!!!   I cancelled the card immediately and went to the bank to change user names and passwords etc.   I do need to get her computer cleaned up though.  Do you have any recomendations for how to do this?  Any advice or help will be much appreciated.

Brian
You should do a factory reset on her computer after copy her Documents folder.
Its a good idea to wipe it entirely because they could have installed malicious software if she visited any links.

Brian
Reporting your card should be sufficient as far as identity protection goes, but I would write down exactly what information she gave up as they might be able to reconstruct her social security number given a date of birth, and city.  Hospitals use to use a specific system for births, and there's a way to look it up.

Aaron
Thanks Brian.   I was panicking and called steve.  He said the same thing.  I am unsure how to reload  windows though.

Aaron
Brian, it's stupid Barbara! Tkx for helping. I gave them no info but did put my credit card in. That's been cancelled. I don't know what they did behind the scenes. If we end up not feeling comfortable doing this ourselves we'd like to hire you rather than data drs!
